00046   /*------------------.

00049 
00050   // This constant is declared as an inlined function instead of a
00051   // simple value because of Windows.  Indeed, libuco uses the
00052   // default_host value at various places, but it does not include
00053   // UAbstractClient.o.  So in the end, our libraries depend on values
00054   // that will be provided by those who link against these libraries.
00055   // This is not portable.
00056   //
00057   // So use an inline function.  This probably means there are several
00058   // instances of this value, one per library.  But who would compare
00059   // the pointers instead of the values?
00060   inline
00061   const char*
00062   UAbstractClient::default_host()
00063   {
00064     // When using Boost.Asio, "localhost" on OS X is IPv6, and nothing
00065     // works as expected.  Make sure we run in IPv4.
00066     // FIXME: Find out why we run in IPv6 by default.
00067     return "127.0.0.1";
00068   }
00069

00071   bool
00072   UAbstractClient::init() const
00073   {
00074     return init_;
00075   }

00080   {
00081     return rc;
00082   }
